message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper discusses methods for measuring the quality of filtering and ranking stages in large-scale retrieval systems, which are commonly used in information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP) applications. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also discusses the use of different features for ranking, which is a common topic in machine learning and natural language processing, suggesting that cs.CL (Computation and Language) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of thousands of queries and categorizing the relative merits of different approaches, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the use of quality scores that do not require relevance judgments, which is a topic in artificial intelligence and machine learning, suggesting that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category.
